intro: Tripleurospermum ziganaense, commonly known as the Ziganaense Groundsel, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
